chapter.title: Tuning &sle; for &sap;
chapter.para: This chapter presents information about preparing and tuning &productname; to work optimally with &sap; applications with &sapconf;. &sapconf; is for &sle; systems that install &sap; applications. Customers who have &sles4sap; should use &saptune;.

note.title: The sapconf Command Has Been Removed
note.para: In &sls; and &productname; 11 and 12, the sapconf command was included in the package with the same name.

For &sls; and &productname; 15 this has been changed: the command sapconf have been removed from the sapconf package. The package contains a &systemd; service only. There is no &sapconf; command line tool anymore, no &sapconf;/&tuned; profiles, and no &tuned;.

sect1.title: Tuning &slea; Systems with &sapconf; 4
sect1.para: The package sapconf is available in &sls; and &s4s;. This package contains the tuned profile sapconf. This single tuning profile sets recommended parameters for the following types of &sap; applications: &netweaver;, &hana; and &hana;-based applications.

listitem.para: sap-netweaver (&tuned; profile)
sap-hana (&tuned; profile)
sap-bobj (&tuned; profile)
sap-ase (&tuned; profile)
&sapconf; (&tuned; profile)

sect1.para: Note that if you previously made changes to the system tuning, those changes may be overwritten by the &sapconf; profile.

listitem.para: A &systemd; service that ensures &tuned; and related services are running and the sapconf profile is applied.
The &tuned; profile sapconf that applies configured &sapconf; tuning parameters using a script and configuration files.

sect1.para: To use &sapconf;, make sure that the packages tuned and sapconf are installed on your system.

note.title: Unified Profiles in &sls; and &productname;Â &productnumber;
note.para: In &sls; and &productname; 15 and above, only a single &tuned; profile, sapconf, is shipped. It is equivalent to the profiles sap-hana/sap-netweaver shipped in earlier versions of &productname;.

sect1.title: Tuning &slea; Systems with &sapconf; 5
sect1.para: The package sapconf is available in &sls; and &s4s;. It sets recommended parameters for the following types of &sap; applications: &netweaver;, &hana; and &hana;-based applications.

listitem.para: sapconf-netweaver (&sapconf; profile as a replacement for &tuned; profile)
sapconf-hana (&sapconf; profile as a replacement for &tuned; profile)
sapconf-bobj (&sapconf; profile as a replacement for &tuned; profile)
sapconf-ase (&sapconf; profile as a replacement for &tuned; profile)
no profiles anymore

sect1.para: Note that if you previously made changes to the system tuning, those changes may be overwritten by &sapconf;.
&sapconf; 5 ships a &systemd; service which applies the tuning and ensures that related services are running.
To use &sapconf;, make sure that the package sapconf is installed on your system.

note.title: No Profiles in &sls; and &productname;Â &productnumber;
note.para: In &sls; and &productname; 15, &sapconf; no longer supports profiles.

sect2.title: Using tuned Together with &sapconf;
sect2.para: With version 5 &sapconf; does not rely on &tuned; anymore. This means both tools can be used independently. &sapconf; will print a warning in its log if tuned service is started.

note.title: Important: Using tuned and &sapconf; together
note.para: If you are going to use tuned and &sapconf; simultaneously, be very careful, that both tools do not configure the same system parameters.
